item.title: Web ÂºÄÂèëÊåáÂçó
item.description:
Guide

  • Learn to Code ‚Äî For Free ‚Äî Coding Courses for Busy People - Learn to Code ‚Äî For Free.
  • MDN Web Docs - The MDN Web Docs site provides information about Open Web technologies including HTML, CSS, and APIs for both Web sites and progressive web apps.
  • Web Development for Beginners - A Curriculum - 24 Lessons, 12 Weeks, Get Started as a Web Developer
  • The Modern JavaScript Tutorial - Modern JavaScript Tutorial: simple, but detailed explanations with examples and tasks, including: closures, document and events, object oriented programming and more.
  • Can I use... Support tables for HTML5, CSS3, etc - "Can I use" provides up-to-date browser support tables for support of front-end web technologies on desktop and mobile web browsers.
  • W3Schools Online Web Tutorials - Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
  • DEV Community üë©‚Äçüíªüë®‚Äçüíª - A constructive and inclusive social network for software developers. With you every step of your journey.
  • Medium - Every idea needs a Medium.
  • Sitepoint - Stay at the cutting edge of tech
  • Fireship.io - Training and Consulting for App Developers | Full Courses, Video Lessons, Chat, and More.
  • Master the JavaScript Ecosystem - ui.dev - Comprehensive learning resources for mastering the JavaScript ecosystem.
  • React Training - React Corporate Workshops, Training, and Consulting.
  • awesome-lowcode - ÂõΩÂÜÖ‰Ωé‰ª£Á†ÅÂπ≥Âè∞‰ªé‰∏öËÄÖ‰∫§ÊµÅ

Frame

  • React - A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
  • Vue.js - The Progressive JavaScript Framework
  • Angular - The modern web developer's platform
  • Svelte - Cybernetically enhanced web apps
  • Lit - Simple. Fast. Web Components.

UI

React

  • Material-UI - Material-UI is a simple and customizable component library to build faster, beautiful, and more accessible React applications. Follow your own design system, or start with Material Design.
  • Ant Design - An enterprise-class UI design language and React UI library.
  • Chakra UI - ‚ö°Ô∏è Simple, Modular & Accessible UI Components for your React Applications

Vue

  • Vuetify - üêâ Material Component Framework for Vue
  • Vant - Lightweight Mobile UI Components built on Vue

Surveys

  • W3Techs - extensive and reliable web technology surveys - W3Techs provides information about the usage of various types of technologies on the web.

Blog

  • 2ality ‚Äì JavaScript and more
  • Front-end Web Development, Chewed Up ‚Üê Alligator.io - Learn Angular 2+, Vue.js, React, TypeScript, Ionic, JavaScript (ES6/ES2015+) & CSS with short, straightforward posts.
  • Overreacted - Personal blog by Dan Abramov. I explain with words and code.
  • RWieruch - Software Engineer for React.js, Node.js, GraphQL and JavaScript. Based in Berlin, German/English speaking. Consulting/Freelancing for Web Development project: Code Audits/Reviews, Workshops, Training, Implementation ...
  • Dave Ceddia - Articles to help you learn and master frontend development with React.
  • Charlie Gerard | Senior frontend developer & Creative Technologist - Collection of side projects, conference talks and blog posts experimenting with frontend technologies and human-computer interaction.

item.title: JavaScript for impatient programmers (ES2021 edition)
item.description:
ËØª‰π¶Á¨îËÆ∞: Âàõ‰Ωú‰∏çÊòìÔºåÊé®ËçêË¥≠‰π∞‰ΩúËÄÖÊ≠£Áâà‰π¶Á±çÔºåBuy the book

ÁõÆÂΩï (Table of contents)

I BACKGROUND

  1. Before you buy the book
  2. FAQ: book and supplementary material
  3. History and evolution of JavaScript
  4. New JavaScript features
  5. FAQ: JavaScript

II‚ÄÇFIRST STEPS

  1. Using JavaScript: the big picture
  2. Syntax
  3. Consoles: interactive JavaScript command lines
  4. Assertion API
  5. Getting started with quizzes and exercises

III‚ÄÇVARIABLES AND VALUES

  1. Variables and assignment
  2. Values
  3. Operators

IV‚ÄÇPRIMITIVE VALUES

  1. The non-values undefined and null
  2. Booleans
  3. Numbers
  4. Math
  5. Bigints ‚Äì arbitrary-precision integers [ES2020] (advanced)
  6. Unicode ‚Äì a brief introduction (advanced)
  7. Strings
  8. Using template literals and tagged templates
  9. Symbols

V‚ÄÇCONTROL FLOW AND DATA FLOW

  1. Control flow statements
  2. Exception handling
  3. Callable values
  4. Evaluating code dynamically: eval(), new Function() (advanced)

VI‚ÄÇMODULARITY

  1. Modules
  2. Single objects
  3. Prototype chains and classes

VII‚ÄÇCOLLECTIONS

  1. Synchronous iteration
  2. Arrays (Array)
  3. Typed Arrays: handling binary data (advanced)
  4. Maps (Map)
  5. WeakMaps (WeakMap) (advanced)
  6. Sets (Set)
  7. WeakSets (WeakSet) (advanced)
  8. Destructuring
  9. Synchronous generators (advanced)

VIII‚ÄÇASYNCHRONICITY

  1. Asynchronous programming in JavaScript
  2. Promises for asynchronous programming [ES6]
  3. Async functions
  4. Asynchronous iteration

IX‚ÄÇMORE STANDARD LIBRARY

  1. Regular expressions (RegExp)
  2. Dates (Date)
  3. Creating and parsing JSON (JSON)

item.title: ÁªÑ‰ª∂Ëß£ËÄ¶ÁöÑ‰∏Ä‰∫õÊÄùËÄÉ
item.description:
Ëá™ÂâçÁ´Ø‰∏âÂ§ßÊ°ÜÊû∂ ( Vue , React , Angular ) ‰ª•ÂèäÂêéËµ∑‰πãÁßÄ Svelte Âá∫Áé∞‰πãÂêéÔºåÂêÑÁßçÁªÑ‰ª∂ÔºåËΩÆÂ≠ê„ÄÇÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÈÉΩÊ≤°Â∞ëÈÄ†ËøáÔºå‰∏Ä‰∫õÂ§ßÂÖ¨Âè∏ÊàñËÄÖÊúâÁ≤æÂäõÁöÑ‰∫∫ÔºåÂú®Á†îÁ©∂ LowCode Êàñ NoCodeÔºå‰πüÊúâ‰∏Ä‰∫õËêΩÂú∞ÊàñËÄÖÂÖ∑‰ΩìÊñπÊ°à„ÄÇ

ËÉåÊôØ

‰ΩÜÂ∞±ÊàëËá™Ë∫´ÁªèÂéÜÂèäÊé•Ëß¶È°πÁõÆËÄåË®ÄÔºåÈ°πÁõÆËøòÊòØÂÅúÁïôÂú®Â¶Ç‰ΩïÁºñÂÜôÁªÑ‰ª∂ÁöÑÂ±ÇÊ¨°‰∏äÔºåÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑÂÆûÁé∞‰∏Ä‰∫õÂ§çÁî®„ÄÇ‰∏Ä‰∫õÂéÜÂè≤È°πÁõÆÂõ†‰∏∫ÈúÄÊ±ÇÁöÑËø≠‰ª£ÔºåÂäüËÉΩÂú®‰∏çÊñ≠Â¢ûÂä†ÔºåÂÜô‰ª£Á†ÅÁöÑ‰∫∫Âëò‰πüÂú®‰∏çÊñ≠Êõ¥ÊõøÔºå‰∫§Êé•„ÄÇÂ∞±‰ºöÂØºËá¥ÊúÄÂêéÁöÑÊé•ÊâãÈ°πÁõÆÁöÑ‰∫∫ÁóõËã¶‰∏çÂ†™ÔºåÈáçÊûÑÔºü‰∏çÁé∞ÂÆûÔºåÊó∂Èó¥‰∏çÂ§üÔºå‰πãÂâçÁöÑÈúÄÊ±Ç‰πü‰∏çÊ∏ÖÊ•ö„ÄÇÁªßÁª≠‰øùÊåÅÔºüÂ∞±Èù¢‰∏¥ÁùÄÊÄé‰πàÂéªÂú®ÂéüÈ°πÁõÆ‰πã‰∏äÁªßÁª≠Ëø≠‰ª£„ÄÇ ËøõÈÄÄ‰∏§Èöæ...

Âú®‰πãÂâçÁöÑÈúÄÊ±ÇÊØ´‰∏çÁü•ÊÉÖÁöÑÊÉÖÂÜµ‰∏ãÔºåÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂÆåÊàêÈúÄÊ±ÇÂäüËÉΩÁöÑËø≠‰ª£ÔºåUI ÊîπÁâàÔºüÂè™ËÉΩÈÄöËøáÂÖ®Â±ÄÊêúÁ¥¢‰∏Ä‰∫õÂÖ≥ÈîÆËØçÔºåÂÖ≥ÈîÆÂ≠óÂéª‰∏ÄÊ≠•Ê≠•Âêë‰∏ä debug Ê∫êÁ†Å„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûú‰ª£Á†Å‰∏≠ÁâµÊâØËøáÂ§öÁöÑ‰∏öÂä°ÈÄªËæëÔºåÂ∞±ÂÆåÂÖ®ÊáµÈÄº‰∫ÜÔºåÊ≤°‰∫∫Áü•ÈÅì‰πãÂâçÁöÑÈúÄÊ±ÇÊòØ‰ªÄ‰πà?_?!!!

‰ª• React ‰∏∫‰æãÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÊØè‰∏™‰∫∫ÈÉΩÊúâËá™Â∑±ÂØπÁªÑ‰ª∂ÁöÑÁêÜËß£Ôºå‰∏çÂêåÁöÑ‰∫∫Á´ôÂú®‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÁª¥Â∫¶ÂéªÂ∞ÅË£ÖÔºåÂ∞±ÂØºËá¥ÊúÄÂêéÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÁªìÊûÑÔºå‰ª£Á†ÅÁªìÊûÑ‰πüÊòØÂçÉÂ∑Æ‰∏áÂà´„ÄÇ

  • Êó†Áä∂ÊÄÅÁªÑ‰ª∂: ‰∏çÊ∂âÂèäËøáÂ§öÁä∂ÊÄÅ‰∫§‰∫íÔºåÂæàÂÆπÊòìÂÆûÁé∞ÔºåÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÁöÑÊÄùË∑ØÈÉΩÂ∑Æ‰∏çÂ§ö„ÄÇ
  • ÊúâÁä∂ÊÄÅÁªÑ‰ª∂: ‰∏ÄÊó¶Ê∂âÂèäÂà∞Áä∂ÊÄÅÔºå‰∏öÂä°ÈÄªËæëÔºå‰∫§‰∫í„ÄÇ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÁªÑ‰ª∂Â∞±ÂèòÂæó‰∏çÂÜçÂèØÊéß„ÄÇÊØè‰∏™‰∫∫ÁöÑÈ£éÊ†º‰πüÈÉΩ‰ΩìÁé∞ÁöÑÊ∑ãÊºìÂ∞ΩËá¥ÔºÅ
    • ÁªÑ‰ª∂ÂÜÖÂèëËµ∑ËØ∑Ê±ÇÔºåÂêÑÁßçËØ∑Ê±ÇÔºåÂ§ßÈáèÊé•Âè£Áõ∏‰∫í‰æùËµñ„ÄÇÂ¶ÇÊûúÊ∂âÂèäÂà∞Â§ö‰∏™Êé•Âè£Âπ∂Ë°åÔºåÂêé‰∏Ä‰∏™Êé•Âè£‰æùËµñ‰∏ä‰∏Ä‰∏™Êé•Âè£ÁöÑËøîÂõûÂÄºÔºåÂÜôÊ≥ïÂèàÊòØÂêÑÊúâÁâπËâ≤„ÄÇ
    • Âá∫Áé∞Â§ßÈáèÁöÑ‰∏öÂä°ÈÄªËæëÂàÜÊîØÔºåÊ†πÊçÆ‰∏öÂä° return Âá∫‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÁªÑ‰ª∂ ‚ï•Ôπè‚ï•
    • Áõ¥Êé•Âú®ÁªÑ‰ª∂ÂÜÖÂÆûÁé∞‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊàñÂ§ö‰∏™Â≠êÁªÑ‰ª∂ („Éé„Å∏Ôø£„ÄÅ)
    • Â≠êÁªÑ‰ª∂‰∏äÊåÇËΩΩÁùÄÂ§ßÈáèÁöÑ propsÔºåÂ±ûÊÄßÊúâÊó∂ÂÄôÂ§öÂà∞‰ª§‰∫∫ÂèëÊåáÔºåÊúâÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÊñπÊ≥ïÔºåÁä∂ÊÄÅÔºåËá™ÂÆö‰πâÁöÑ xxxÔºåÂêÑÁßç‰º†ÈÄí„ÄÇ o(‚ï•Ôπè‚ï•)o
    • Ê¨¢ËøéÂ§ßÂÆ∂ÁªßÁª≠Ë°•ÂÖÖÂêêÊßΩ...

ÊÄùËÄÉ

ÊàëÂØπÊï∞ÊçÆÁöÑÁêÜËß£ÔºåÂÆÉÊó¢Ë¥¥Ëøë‰∫é‰∏öÂä°Â±ÇÔºå‰πüËÄ¶ÂêàÁùÄ‰∫§‰∫íÂ±ÇÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏çËÉΩÂæàÂ•ΩÁöÑÂàÜÁ¶ªÁªÑÁªáËøô‰∏âÂ±ÇÔºåÂæàÂèØËÉΩÁâµ‰∏ÄÂèëËÄåÂä®ÂÖ®Ë∫´„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•Êï∞ÊçÆÊòØÊ†∏ÂøÉÔºåÊó¢ÊòØ‰∏öÂä°ÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉÔºå‰πüÊòØÁªÑ‰ª∂ÁöÑÊ†∏ÂøÉ„ÄÇ

  • Êï∞ÊçÆÔºå‰∏öÂä°ÈÄªËæëÔºå‰∫§‰∫íÈÉΩ‰ºöÂΩ±ÂìçÊúÄÁªàÈúÄË¶ÅÊ∏≤ÊüìÁöÑUIËßÜÂõæ„ÄÇ
  • ÁºñÂÜôÁªÑ‰ª∂Êó∂ÔºåÈ¶ñÂÖàÂàÜÊûê‰∏öÂä°ÈúÄÊ±ÇÔºåÂØπÁªÑ‰ª∂ËøõË°åÂàÜÂ±Ç„ÄÇÂ§ßËá¥ÂàÜ‰∏∫Êï∞ÊçÆ (DataSource)Ôºå‰∫§‰∫í (Action)ÔºåUIËßÜÂõæ (View)‰∏âÂ±Ç„ÄÇ
    • Êï∞ÊçÆÂ§ÑÁêÜ (Handle): ÊâøËΩΩÁùÄÊ†∏ÂøÉ‰∏öÂä°ÈÄªËæëÔºåÂØπÊï∞ÊçÆËøõË°åÊ†ºÂºèÂåñËæìÂá∫Ôºå‰æõ UI ÁªÑ‰ª∂ËøõË°åÊ†áÂáÜÂåñÊé•Êî∂Ôºå‰∏ÄËà¨‰ª• function ÂΩ¢ÂºèÂ≠òÂú®„ÄÇ
    • ÂâØ‰ΩúÁî® (Effect): ‰ª•ÊàëÁõÆÂâçÊé•Ëß¶Âà∞ÁöÑÂú∫ÊôØÔºå‰∏ªË¶ÅËøòÊòØ‰ª•‰∫ã‰ª∂‰øÆÊîπÁªÑ‰ª∂Áä∂ÊÄÅÔºåÊõ¥Êñ∞Êï∞ÊçÆÂèäUIËßÜÂõæ‰∏∫‰∏ª„ÄÇÊâÄ‰ª•‰∫ã‰ª∂ÂèäÁä∂ÊÄÅÂèòÊõ¥ÂèØËÉΩ‰ºöÂêåÊó∂Âá∫Áé∞Âú® Êï∞ÊçÆÂ§ÑÁêÜ Âíå UI ËßÜÂõæ ‰∏≠„ÄÇÂú®Êï∞ÊçÆÂ§ÑÁêÜ‰∏≠ÔºåË∞ÉÁî® (Call) ÊñπÊ≥ïÔºõÂú® UI ‰∏≠ÔºåÁªëÂÆö (Bind) ‰∫ã‰ª∂ÂèäÁä∂ÊÄÅ„ÄÇUI Â±ÇÂ∞ΩÈáè‰∏çÁõ¥Êé•Â§ÑÁêÜÊàñÂ∞ëÂ§ÑÁêÜÊ∫êÊï∞ÊçÆ„ÄÇ

‰∏æ‰æã

  • ‰∏öÂä°‰∏≠Â∏∏‰ºöÊúâËøôÊ†∑‰∏ÄÁßçÈúÄÊ±ÇÔºåÁî®Êà∑ÂèØ‰ª•Âä®ÊÄÅÁöÑÊñ∞Â¢ûÂà†Èô§‰∏Ä‰∏™ÂàóË°®ÔºåÂõ†‰∏∫ÊØèÊ¨°ÈúÄË¶ÅÂ§ÑÁêÜÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÔºåÂíåÂ±ïÁ§∫ÁöÑ UI ÂΩ¢ÂºèÈÉΩÊòØ‰∏çÁ°ÆÂÆöÁöÑ„ÄÇÂèØËÉΩÊàë‰ª¨ÊØèÊ¨°ÂÅöÈúÄÊ±ÇÊó∂ÈÉΩÂÆûÁé∞‰∏ÄÊ¨°‰ª£Á†ÅÔºåÊàñËÄÖÊääÊñ∞Â¢ûÂíåÂà†Èô§ÊñπÊ≥ïÊèêÂèñÂá∫Êù•ÔºåÂÆûÁé∞ÈÉ®ÂàÜÂ§çÁî®„ÄÇ‰ª• React Hook ‰∏∫‰æãÔºö
/* hooks/useDataOP.js */
import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
import { v4 as uuidv4 } from 'uuid';
import cloneDeep from 'lodash/cloneDeep';

// ‰ΩøÁî®Symbol‰Ωú‰∏∫Êï∞ÊçÆÁöÑÂîØ‰∏Äkey
const safeKey = Symbol('tid');

// Ê†ºÂºèÂåñÊ∫êÊï∞ÊçÆ
const opFmtData = (data) => {
  return cloneDeep(data).map((i) => {
    i[safeKey] = uuidv4();
    return i;
  });
};

/**
 * useDataOP
 * @author lencx
 * @param rawData - Ê∫êÊï∞ÊçÆ
 */
export default function useDataOP(rawData = []) {
  const [opData, setData] = useState([]);
  const [opType, setType] = useState(null);
  const [isOk, setOk] = useState(true);

  // Êï∞ÊçÆÂàùÂßãÂåñ
  useEffect(() => {
    if (Array.isArray(rawData)) {
      if (rawData.length > 0) {
        const data = opFmtData(rawData);
        setData(data);
      }
      setOk(true);
    } else {
      setOk(false);
    }
    // eslint-disable-next-line react-hooks/exhaustive-deps
  }, []);

  if (!isOk) return console.error('Parameter must be an array!');

  /**
   * Êñ∞Â¢û
   * @param data - Êñ∞Â¢ûÁöÑÊï∞ÊçÆÂØπË±°
   */
  const opAdd = (data = {}) => {
    const result = [...opData, { [safeKey]: uuidv4(), ...data }];
    setData(result);
    setType('add');
    return result;
  };

  /**
   * Âà†Èô§
   * @param value - ÈúÄË¶ÅÂà†Èô§ÁöÑÂÄºÔºåÂ¶ÇÊûú‰∏∫Â≠óÁ¨¶‰∏≤ÊàñÊï∞Â≠óÊó∂ÔºåÈúÄË¶ÅÈÖçÂêàkey‰ΩøÁî®„ÄÇ
   *   Â¶ÇÊûúvalue‰∏∫ÂØπË±°ÔºåÂàô‰∏∫ÈúÄË¶ÅÂà†Èô§ÁöÑËÆ∞ÂΩïÔºåÈÄöËøásafeKeyÊü•ÊâæÂà†Èô§„ÄÇ
   * @param key - ÈªòËÆ§‰∏∫idÔºåÈÄâÂ°´ÔºåÂèØÁúÅÁï•
   */
  const opRemove = (value, key = 'id') => {
    let result;
    if (typeof value === 'string' || typeof value === 'number') {
      result = opData.filter((i) => i[key] !== value);
    } else {
      result = opData.filter((i) => i[safeKey] !== value[safeKey]);
    }
    setData(result);
    setType('remove');
    return result;
  };

  /**
   * ÊéíÂ∫è
   * @param startIndex - ÂΩìÂâç‰ΩçÁΩÆ
   * @param endIndex - ÁõÆÊ†á‰ΩçÁΩÆ
   */
  const opReorder = (startIndex, endIndex) => {
    const result = Array.from(opData);
    const [removed] = result.splice(startIndex, 1);
    result.splice(endIndex, 0, removed);
    setData(result);
    setType('reorder');
    return result;
  };

  return {
    opData,
    opType,
    opAdd,
    opRemove,
    opReorder,
    opRawData: rawData,
    opSafeKey: safeKey,
  };
}
// ‰ΩøÁî®useDataOP
import React, { useState } from 'react';
import useDataOP from '@/hooks/useDataOP';

export default () => {
  const { opData, opAdd, opRemove, opReorder, opSafeKey } = useDataOP([]);
  const [count, setCount] = useState(1);

  const handleAdd = () => {
    setCount(count+1);
    opAdd({ name: `test${count}` });
  }
  return (
    <div>
      <button onClick={handleAdd}>Add</button>
      {opData.map((i, idx) => {
        return (
          <div key={i[opSafeKey]}>
            <span>Name: {i.name}</span>
            {' '}
            <button onClick={() => opRemove(i)}>Remove</button>
            <button onClick={() => opReorder(idx, idx-1)}>Up+1</button>
            <button onClick={() => opReorder(idx, idx+1)}>Down-1</button>
          </div>
        )
      })}
    </div>
  );
}

ÊÄªÁªì

GitHub

ÊéíÂêç‰∏çÂàÜÂÖàÂêé

  • Linus Torvalds
  • Brendan Eich - Founder & CEO, Brave Software. Created JavaScript. Co-founded Mozilla and Firefox.
  • Sindre Sorhus - Full-Time Open-Sourcerer. Wants more empathy & kindness in open source. Focuses on Swift & JavaScript. Makes macOS apps, CLI tools, npm packages. Likes unicorns
  • TJ Holowaychuk - I'm the founder and solo developer of Apex Software. I've written hundreds of open-source projects for the JavaScript and Go communities.
  • Lea Verou - Elected @w3ctag member, CSS WG Invited Expert, HCI researcher at MIT CSAIL. Founder of many open source projects, PrismJS probably being the most popular one.
  • Dan Abramov
  • Ryan Dahl
  • Lin Clark
  • isaacs - Principal Engineer at GitHub npm inventor, founder npm, Inc. Former Node BDFL. All opinions are my own. Literally all of them. I own them all. He/him
  • Wes Bos - I create courses that make learning things like JavaScript easy and fun üî•
  • Zeke Sikelianos - Friendly open-source person localizing @github, @nodejs, and @electron. Previously @npm and @heroku
  • Sarah Drasner - I make tools for developers, projects, and am on the Vue.js core team.
  • Tobias Koppers - Author of webpack
  • Sean Larkin - Technical Program Manager @microsoft for @MicrosoftEdge. Javascript, webpack, Typescript. @webpack core team. @angular cli core team.
  • Jessica Lord - Urban designer turned open source developer. Shared knowledge champion üéâ

  • Kyle Simpson - I like to explore JS and FP techniques. Helping build a culture of engineering excellence for my employer.
  • Douglas Crockford - I was born in Frostbite Falls, Minnesota. I left when I was 6 months old because it was too damn cold. My latest book is How JavaScript Works.
  • John Resig - Chief Architect at @Khan
  • Jason Miller - Making the web faster at @google. Creator of @preactjs.
  • Federico Zivolo - UX Engineer/Front-End Engineer. Creator of bootstrap-material-design and Popper.js. Open Source addicted.
  • John Washam - Software Development Engineer at Amazon
  • Max Stoiber - Co-Founder, @graphcdn ‚ö°Ô∏è Previously @gatsbyjs, before that @github after they acquired @withspectrum. ‚úåÔ∏è Speciality coffee geek, boulderer and skier
  • Eduardo San Martin Morote - Member of the @vuejs core team Speaker, trainer. From üá™üá∏, lives in üá´üá∑
  • Nicholas C. Zakas
  • Axel Rauschmayer
  • Mary Lou
  • ü¶Ä Alex Crichton
  • ü¶Ä Andrew Gallant
  • ü¶Ä Yoshua Wuyts - calm computing. he/they
  • ü¶Ä Kornel - Rust, image compression, web performance.

  • Ëø∑Ê∏° - Creator of vscode-deno. Currently a contributor to Deno @denoland.
  • Evan You
  • Hao Chen - ËäùÂÖ∞Áîü‰∫éÁ©∫Ë∞∑Ôºå‰∏ç‰ª•Êó†‰∫∫ËÄå‰∏çËä≥„ÄÇ

item.title: macOS Á≥ªÂàó
item.description:
APP

  • Awesome Mac - Ô£ø Now we have become very big, Different from the original idea. Collect premium software in various categories.
  • Awesome macOS open source applications - üöÄ Awesome list of open source applications for macOS.
  • CheatSheet - Know your short cuts
  • Xnip - Handy Screenshot App for Mac
  • Bob - Bob ÊòØ‰∏ÄÊ¨æ Mac Á´ØÁøªËØëËΩØ‰ª∂ÔºåÊîØÊåÅÂàíËØçÁøªËØë„ÄÅÊà™ÂõæÁøªËØë‰ª•ÂèäÊâãÂä®ËæìÂÖ•ÁøªËØë„ÄÇ
  • thor - Switch the right application ASAP.
  • Kap - An open-source screen recorder built with web technology
  • ImageOptim - Removes bloated metadata. Saves disk space & bandwidth by compressing images without losing quality.
  • iStat Menus - An advanced system monitor for your menubar.
  • iTerm2 - iTerm2 is a replacement for Terminal and the successor to iTerm.
  • Maccy - Clipboard manager for macOS which does one job - keep your copy history at hand. Period.
  • Hidden Bar - An ultra-light MacOS utility that helps hide menu bar icons
  • Rectangle - Move and resize windows on macOS with keyboard shortcuts and snap areas.
  • Dropover - Dropover is a utility that makes it easier to manage and move content between folders, applications, windows and workspaces using Drag and Drop.
  • System Color Picker - The macOS color picker as an app with more features
  • IINA - The modern media player for macOS.
  • Pock - Widgets manager for MacBook Touch Bar
  • mas - üì¶ Mac App Store command line interface

item.title: WebAssembly Á≥ªÂàó
item.description:
Guide

  • MDN WebAssembly
  • webassembly.org - WebAssembly (abbreviated Wasm) is a binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine. Wasm is designed as a portable compilation target for programming languages, enabling deployment on the web for client and server applications.
  • Rust ü¶Ä and WebAssembly üï∏ - This small book describes how to use Rust and WebAssembly together.
  • Awesome WebAssembly Languages - üòé A curated list of languages that compile directly to or have their VMs in WebAssembly
  • WebAssembly Weekly - A weekly newsletter for keeping on top of what's new in the world of WebAssembly, with tutorials, examples, articles, and more.
  • Awesome Wasm - üòé Curated list of awesome things regarding WebAssembly (wasm) ecosystem.
  • Wasm By Example - A hands-on introduction into WebAssembly ( Wasm ). Containing simple wasm examples and wasm tutorials on how to implement concepts and various tasks using WebAssembly.

WASI & VM & VDOM

  • wasmtime - Standalone JIT-style runtime for WebAssembly, using Cranelift
  • Wasm3 - üöÄ The fastest WebAssembly interpreter, and the most universal runtime
  • Wasmer - üöÄ The leading WebAssembly Runtime supporting WASI and Emscripten.
  • Lucet - Lucet, the Sandboxing WebAssembly Compiler.
  • WasmEdge - WasmEdge Runtime is a high-performance, extensible, and hardware optimized WebAssembly Virtual Machine for automotive, cloud, AI, and blockchain applications.
  • asm-dom - A minimal WebAssembly virtual DOM to build C++ SPA (Single page applications)

Tools

  • wapm - WAPM is the WebAssembly Package Manager.
  • trunk - Build, bundle & ship your Rust WASM application to the web.
  • wasm-tools - Rust tooling for low-level manipulation of WebAssembly modules.
  • wasm-pack - üì¶ ‚ú® your favorite rust -> wasm workflow tool!

Optimizing

  • Shrinking .wasm Code Size
    • Binaryen - Binaryen is a compiler and toolchain infrastructure library for WebAssembly, written in C++. It aims to make compiling to WebAssembly easy, fast, and effective.
    • Twiggy - Twiggy üå± is a code size profiler
  • Optimizing Code (cpp)
  • Superoptimization of WebAssembly Bytecode

Open Source

  • vite-plugin-rsw - üß© wasm-pack plugin for vite@v2
  • rsw-node - ‚ö™Ô∏è wasm-pack build executed in remote deployment
  • wasi-fs-access - This is a demo shell powered by WebAssembly, WASI, Asyncify and File System Access API.
  • FFMPEG.WASM - ffmpeg.wasm is a pure WebAssembly / JavaScript port of FFmpeg. It enables video & audio record, convert and stream right inside browsers.
  • wasm-rust-chip8 - A WebAssembly CHIP-8 emulator written with Rust
  • NoteCalc - is a handy notepad with a smart builtin calculator.
  • Kalker/kalk - is a calculator with math syntax that supports user-defined variables and functions, complex numbers, and estimation of derivatives and integrals
  • wasmboy - Game Boy / Game Boy Color Emulator Library, üéÆ written for WebAssembly using AssemblyScript. üöÄ Demos built with Preact and Svelte. ‚öõÔ∏è
  • Plotters - A rust drawing library for high quality data plotting for both WASM and native, statically and realtimely ü¶Ä üìà üöÄ
  • redshirt - The redshirt operating system is an experiment to build some kind of operating-system-like environment where executables are all in Wasm and are loaded from an IPFS-like decentralized network.
  • Photon - ‚ö° Rust/WebAssembly image processing library
  • markdown-wasm - Markdown parser and HTML generator implemented in WebAssembly, based on md4c.
  • hash-wasm - Hash-WASM is a ‚ö° lightning fast‚ö° hash function library for browsers and Node.js. It is using hand-tuned WebAssembly binaries to calculate the hash faster than other libraries.
  • serde-wasm-bindgen - Native integration of Serde with wasm-bindgen
  • sycamore - A reactive DOM library for Rust in WASM.
  • gumnut - JS parser in Web Assembly / C.
  • box2d-wasm - Box2D physics engine compiled to WebAssembly. Supports TypeScript and ES modules.
  • TensorFlow.js - A WebGL accelerated JavaScript library for training and deploying ML models.

Article

  • WebAssemblyÂÖ•Èó®
  • ÂçÅÂπ¥Á£®‰∏ÄÂâëÔºåWebAssemblyÊòØÂ¶Ç‰ΩïËØûÁîüÁöÑÔºü
  • Is WebAssembly magic performance pixie dust?
  • WebAssembly Actors: From Cloud to Edge - Embrace the actor model to build portable, secure, lightweight WebAssembly modules that thrive in the cloud, at the edge, and anywhere in between.
  • Learning WebAssembly Series - A series of learning texts covering the first steps with WebAssembly for complete beginners.
  • In-browser transcoding of video files with FFmpeg and WebAssembly
  • [Standardizing WASI: A system interface to run WebAssembly outside the web] - (https://hacks.mozilla.org/2019/03/standardizing-wasi-a-webassembly-system-interface)
  • The WebAssembly App Gap
  • Why using WebAssembly and Rust together improves Node.js performance
  • [V8] WebAssembly compilation pipeline
  • Optimizing WebAssembly Startup Time
  • Bringing You Up to Speed on How Compiling WebAssembly is Faster
